message.content:
cs.GT, cs.DS, cs.AI, cs.CC, cs.LG. 

The paper deals with the problem of computing Nash equilibria in graphical games, which is a central topic in game theory (cs.GT). The approach is based on the best response policy, which is a data structure that represents all Nash equilibria of a game and has polynomial size for certain classes of graphs. Therefore, the paper also involves the study of data structures (cs.DS). The algorithms proposed in the paper use techniques from artificial intelligence (cs.AI) and computational complexity (cs.CC) to efficiently compute Nash equilibria that satisfy certain fairness criteria. Finally, the paper also involves the analysis of the social welfare of Nash equilibria, which is a topic in machine learning (cs.LG).
